Utterance: <synch>
Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been okay, a bit stressed with work, but managing it.
It’s understandable to feel that way. Did you get a chance to reach out to your brother as we discussed?
Yes, I did! I sent him a text, and we ended up having a nice conversation.
That’s wonderful! How did it feel to reconnect?
It felt good. We talked about some family memories, and it made me realize how much I miss those connections.
That’s a significant insight. It sounds like it brought some warmth back into your relationship. Do you think you’ll continue reaching out to your family?
I think so. I want to make an effort to stay in touch more regularly.
That’s a great goal. Building those connections can be very rewarding. Now, how has work been since we last spoke?
It’s been hectic. I tried to delegate that task like we talked about, but I still struggled with it.
It’s a process, and it’s okay to find it challenging. What specifically made it difficult for you?
I ended up taking it back because I wasn’t confident it would be done right. I need to work on trusting my team more.
Trust can take time to build. Perhaps we can explore some strategies to help you feel more comfortable with delegation?
Yes, I’d like that. I think I need to set clearer expectations when I delegate.
That’s a good start. Clear communication can help your team understand what you’re looking for. Would you like to practice how to communicate those expectations together?
Sure, that would be helpful.
Great! Let’s say you want to delegate a project. What would you typically say to your team member?
I usually just say, “Can you handle this for me?” but I realize that’s not very clear.
Right, let’s try to frame it differently. You could say, “I’d like you to take on this project. Here’s what I need from you: [specific tasks]. Can we set a deadline for this?”
That sounds much better. It gives them a clear understanding of what I expect.
Exactly! It opens up a dialogue for questions as well. How do you feel about trying this approach?
I feel more confident about it. I’ll give it a shot and see how it goes.
Wonderful! Remember, it’s a learning experience for both you and your team. Now, let’s talk about your work-life balance. How has that been lately?
It’s been tough. I find myself working late and then feeling guilty for not spending enough time with my daughter.
Balancing work and family can be challenging. Have you considered setting boundaries around your work hours?
I’ve thought about it, but it’s hard to stick to them.
It can be tough, especially when work demands are high. What if you set specific times for work and family, and communicated those to your team?
That could work. If they know when I’m unavailable, it might help me stick to it.
Absolutely! It’s about creating a structure that works for you. Would you like to set a goal for establishing those boundaries this week?
Yes, I’ll try to set a specific end time for my workday and stick to it.
That’s a great goal! Remember to communicate this to your team, so they’re aware. How do you plan to spend that extra time with your daughter?
I want to take her out for ice cream or maybe a movie. Just some quality time together.
That sounds lovely! Quality time can strengthen your bond. Is there anything else you’d like to focus on today?
I’ve been thinking about my health and fitness lately. I want to make sure I’m taking care of myself.
That’s an important topic. How have you been feeling about your health and fitness?
I’ve been exercising regularly, but I sometimes struggle with my diet, especially when I’m busy.
It’s easy to let nutrition slip when life gets hectic. Would you like to explore some meal planning strategies?
Yes, that would be helpful. I want to make healthier choices.
Great! One approach could be to plan your meals for the week ahead. You could prepare some meals in advance to save time during busy days. How does that sound?
That sounds doable. I could set aside a few hours on the weekend to prep.
Exactly! It can help you stay on track with your nutrition. Would you like to set a goal for meal prepping this week?
Yes, I’ll aim to prep at least two meals for the week.
That’s a solid goal! I’m excited to hear how it goes. Remember to be kind to yourself during this process. Change takes time.
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate your support and guidance.
You’re doing great! I look forward to hearing about your progress in our next session. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss before we wrap up?
No, I think we covered a lot today. Thank you!
You’re welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next time.
Bye!
